1.q_string: A particle of mass m and charge +q is midway between two fixed charged particles, each having a charge +q and at a distance 2L apart. The middle charge is displaced slightly along the line joining the fixed charges and released. The time period of oscillation is proportional to

Three point charges \(+\mathrm{q}\), \(-\mathrm{q}\) and \(+\mathrm{q}\) are respectively placed at the vertices \(\mathrm{P}, \mathrm{Q}\) and \(\mathrm{R}\) of an equilateral triangle as = shown in the figure. If \(\mathrm{F}=\frac{1}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}} \frac{\mathrm{q}^{2}}{\mathrm{r}^{2}}\). where \(\mathrm{r}\) is the side of the triangle, then the force on charge at \(\mathrm{Q}\) due to charges =at P and R is

Two small identical balls \(P\) and \(Q\), each of mass \(\sqrt{3} / 10\) grams, carry identical charges and are suspended by threads of equal length. At equilibrium, they position themselves as shown in the figure. What is the charge on each ball? 

Given: \(\frac{1}{4 \pi \varepsilon_{0}}=9 \times 10^{9} \mathrm{Nm}^{2} \mathrm{C}^{-2}\) and \(\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{ms}^{-2}\)

Two charges, each equal to \(q\), are kept at \(x=-a\) and \(x=a\) on the \(x\) -axis. A particle of mass \(m\) and charge \(q_{0}=\frac{q}{2}\) is placed at the origin. The charge \(\mathrm{q}_{0}\) is given a small displacement \(\mathrm{x}(\mathrm<<\mathrm{a})\) along the \(\mathrm{x}\) -axis and released. The restoring force acting on \(\mathrm{q}_{0}\) is \(k=\frac{1}{4\pi\varepsilon_{0}}\)

A metallic spherical shell of radius R has a charge –Q distributed uniformly on it. A point charge +Q is placed at the centre of the shell. Which of the following graphs represents the variation of electric field E with distance r from the centre of the shell?

Its speed (in ms<sup>–1</sup>) after 10 seconds will be (neglect gravitation)
